you have changed the disk layout, do you get the grub menu (first question)
nope, no grub menu
ok - so what has happened is the partition that your /boot file system is on has been re-orginised due to the new disk, hence why it can't be found to give you the menu
you'll need to re-install grub to the mbr pointing at the correct partition
it was and still is sdb1
grub doesn't use "sdb1" for references
the OS named disks and how grub names disk are quite different
yeah, it's using UUID..  which I figured wouldn't change..  but maybe they do?
it's not using a uuid for the mbr
thanks for the link..  I'll read through that, though it looks identical to the things I've already been trying from other sites
keep in mind, that to the OS your disks haven't changed, but to the bios your disks have, there is a new one
that's the key
I figured at least a full reinstall would fix the issue, by reinstalling and reconfiguring grub
but I still get it =/
don't need a full re-install, just re-apply grub to the mbr, but this time pointing at the correct partition for /boot
yeah, but I *did* a full reinstall, and it didn't change anything
that's quite possible
